programme.desc: Lucas heads west to Bountiful, Utah, to build a dream backyard on the side of a mountain; faced with many challenges, Lucas creates a Tuscan-themed pool complete with a spa, a linear fire wall and a grotto.

programme.title: Scaled
programme.desc: The team create a circus-themed enclosure for the Hazelaar family's bearded dragon, Nash; Jason helps Greg out with Emma's surprise party by bringing some of his own reptiles, but Greg might not be comfortable with Jason's pet tarantula at the party.

programme.title: Scaled
programme.desc: Greg and Lucas make clients Aaron and Karen a dinosaur-themed enclosure for a new reptile they're introducing into their growing family; with Jason and Chris' guidance, animal lover Kate picks out an affectionate blue Tegu that melts her heart.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: After numerous credible eyewitness accounts of the Tasmanian Tiger in Australia, James Cook University has researchers on the move; Forrest joins their study before heading deep into the Cape York Peninsula.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest tracks clues and eyewitness accounts suggesting that the Formosan clouded leopard is still alive after being declared extinct; he treks deep into the jungles of Taiwan where a run-in with a predator might just solve a mystery.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest Galante visits the island of Java in Indonesia to look for the Javan Tiger; this exotic predator was declared extinct in 2003, but park rangers and locals have had recent sightings and are collecting evidence of its existence.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest travels to the Faroe Islands to look for any trace of the great auk; his passionate search for a large flightless seabird takes him through some of the most scenic and rugged terrain he's ever seen.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest combs the Florida Everglades for a predator rumored to exist for years, the Black Panther; it might be a case of mistaken identity, but while scouring the landscape, discoveries suggest that it might be more than a rumor.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Madagascar's Pachylemurs were red, furry giants, nearly the size of great apes; recently discovered remains disprove that they went extinct 1,000 years ago; Forrest tries to prove the giant species still lives.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest teams up with a specialist in Newfoundland in search of a predator that was declared extinct in 1930; the duo meets with a hunter that shot what is believed to be a wolf and uncovers evidence that suggests the species could be alive.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest is determined to find out if the famously reclusive Ivory Billed Woodpecker still exists; the alligator and poisonous snake infested swamps of Louisiana make for a challenging mission, but he is prepared for anything.
